intro: Rudgea sessilis subsp. sessilis, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by spherical fruits that turn from green to yellow when mature. The fruit has a sweet, aromatic pulp and is often consumed fresh or used in culinary applications. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
